name: Idea Hotel Milano Corso Genova

reviews.text: I was very impressed with the decor...it was modern and sleek and for the price it was almost too good to be true. The hotel wasn't right near the airport...but it was close enough. They provide a nice breakfast bag to go if you have to take an early flight.
reviews.title: Great value for the product

reviews.text: Also despite having a bar/restaurant open very late and planes flying nearby, we didn't hear a thing!
reviews.title: Good for one night stay

reviews.text: This is a good basic hotel that for 1 night suited us very well. Its very centrally located, and the staff were pleasant and professional, and we were able to leave our luggage there before our late night flight. Breakfast was included and was very good. The rooms are small, but the beds are comfortable and it was quiet - if you were there for longer than 1-2 nights I think it would be too tight, but as I said for 1 night it was fine. Good price through Expedia - Milan hotels are expensive so I was happy with what we paid given the standard and location.
reviews.title: Very good for a short stay

reviews.text: Having read a few reviews that rooms are almost too small I was positively suprised when I saw the room that I'd call as a normal, small hotel room. The room was very tidy and in a very good condition. I would have had no use for any extra space. Considering an inexpensive price a room for one night in this hotel is excellent value for money. And of course the location is really good and probably a main reason for many people to choose this hotel. In brief: a great location and a nice but small room for little money. Top deal!
reviews.title: it´s ok

reviews.text: Comfortable but small room, located within easy walking distance of many restaurants. Staff not too friendly. There was an issue with the parking ...€75 for three bikes on one car space..absurd! After a discussion they said €45 .. still absurd and no feasable reason as to why ?!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: The hotel is Ok.
reviews.title: Decent hotel.

reviews.text: Walking distance from city center, but also pretty quiet location.
reviews.title: value for money hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice sleep.
reviews.title: Great location - basic room

reviews.text: A little bit small room, it was fine.
reviews.title: simple hotel , worst dinning room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - the first morning we came to the dining room at 9am, the breakfast is served from 6;30am through 10;30 am
reviews.title: Walking distance to city centre

reviews.text: A fairly bland and average hotel lacking the charm of some of its Milan counterparts. Breakfast is typically Italian with lots of cakes but a very ordinary cooked breakfast. They make very good espresso and hot chocolate. Rooms are comfortable and clean and block out blinds are very nice if you want to block out the sound and light (although it is in a quiet part of Milan). There are restaurants and gelato places within 5min walk but a walk into the city centre will take 10-15 minutes. I checked in with 5 other travelling companions late at night and they no longer had rooms for two of them (despite notifying them of our late arrival). Fortunately my room was still available and they made alternative arrangements for my companions. Service varied depending on who Watson the front desk.
reviews.title: Average Milan Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed 5 nights at this hotel.
reviews.title: Worth considering for a budget city breal

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Tiny box rooms!!!

reviews.text: - good location 5 minutes from tram or 15 minute walk to city centre and 10 minutes from the Naviglio district (Bohemian areaby canal with many restaurants )
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: - situated in a quiet, pleasant area with shops, cafes and restaurants nearby
reviews.title: Was OK

reviews.text: The hotel has a nice location but is a fair way from the Metro. Use the 2 tram or the bus. Spartan room. Lovely big bathroom. No information in room about prices. Wifi wasn't free and seemed to be complex to set up. The cable tv had a choice of languages: Italian, Italian and Italian. Surely a subscription to foreign stations wouldn't break the bank for the hotel? Breakfast was good but they ran out of plates and coffee cups during busy periods. Lots of good places to eat nearby.
reviews.title: Spartan but well situated and comfortable

reviews.text: we stayed in Milan for two nights arriving late saturday evening with the intent to explore Milan on Sunday, i shall warn you now nothing is open on Sundays in Milan. Other than that we found the hotel to be nice and comfortable, the room was a good size and decorated fairly modern and is within a good distance to all the sights of milan. The breakfast provided was also very pleasant
reviews.title: did the trick

reviews.text: In the website says the hotel is 1 Mike away from Melpanse, that is wrong, the hotel is 15 minutes away from the airport, basically the hotel is the middle of nowhere. If you want to get a shuttle that goes to Malpensa, you have to book it a day ahead, if not you are stocked in the hotel. The hotel is clean and employee are nice, but there is not even tea and coffee service in your room. I would never comeback here.
reviews.title: 100% false advertising

reviews.text: An average Milan city centre hotel with small rooms which would benefit from a lick of paint. The Corso is ok if you are in Milan on business and have to stay the night.
reviews.title: Average Hotel - Not for a romantic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was compact to say the least. Stains on the carpet, cigarette burns on some fittings, shower tray did not drain properly.... you get the picture.
reviews.title: Nice hotel on good location

description: The Hotel Milano Corso Genova overlooks a peaceful and quiet street, situated at walking distance from the city centre with its elegant boutiques and places of cultural interest, and from the Duomo cathedral, the most representative monument of the city of Milan.The Hotel’s rooms, some of which have a beautiful panoramic view of the gothic cathedral, offer a comfortable accommodation, great quality and a professional service with attention to every detail.
